New Records: Dawid Malan scored 140, his highest score in ODIs.
Jonny Bairstow reached his 100th ODI cap.
Shoriful Islam had an exceptional comeback with 3 wickets in the last 5 overs.
Key Match Events: England won by 137 runs after a broadly comical finale.
Sam Curran hit leg stump but didn't dislodge the bail.
Dawid Malan's 140 set victory up, with Jonny Bairstow's 52 and 82 from Joe Root helping the defending champions to a target of 365.
Reece Topley took his first two ODI World Cup wickets in his first over.
Towhid Hridoy survived a review after being adjudged LBW.
Litton Das fell for a valiant 76, and Jos Buttler took a smart catch.
Mark Wood had the fastest delivery at the World Cup (kph).
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and fielded first.
England made one change, bringing in Reece Topley instead of Moeen Ali.
Bangladesh's opening pair struggled, with Tanzid Hasan and Najmul Shanto dismissed early.
Shakib Al Hasan called correctly after Jos Buttler won the toss.
Post-Match Reflections: England's Net Run Rate improved to 0.55 after the match.
Jos Buttler praised the team's resilience after a close win.
Dawid Malan became England's oldest centurion at the World Cup, aged 36 years, 37 days.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dharamsala pitch was noted for its sandy base and electrical shower overnight.
Ben Stokes sat out due to a hip issue, but Reece Topley took his place.
Bangladesh's performance was hindered by key dismissals and poor batting decisions.
